concept.title: GPIO Overview
concept.shortdesc: General Purpose Input/Output (GPIO) allows easy serial expansion of I/O through an interface.

conbody.p: GPIO provides additional control and monitoring when the microcontroller or chipset has insufficient I/O ports, or in systems where serial communication and control from a remote location is advantageous.

section.title: Required background
section.p: Before beginning you should know the following:

li.p: Know the architecture of the platform on which you are implementing.
Understand the functions you are implementing.

section.title: Architecture Description
section.p: There are two parts of a GPIO. They are the input path and the output path.

ul.li: Input Path: The input path is used to connect an external signal to the internals of the microprocessor. This mode is generally used for analog input and output to avoid oscillations in the internal digital data bus when the signal level at the input is near the HIGH or LOW threshold.
Output Path: The output path is used to bring external signals from the internals of the microprocessor to the external world.
